questions.question: Who is the protagonist of The Most Dangerous Game?
Who is the antagonist of "The Most Dangerous Game"?
Is Rainsford a static or dynamic character?
Rainsford comes to the island because he...

choices.answer: swims to it after falling overboard
wishes to write an article about the General
wants to prove that Zaroff can't successfully hunt him
wants to bring the evil Zaroff to justice

questions.question: Which of the following statements best describes how Zaroff justifies his hunting human beings?

choices.answer: Animal life is more precious than human life
Only the strong deserve to survive
Individual freedom is more important than laws
Human beings are not morally responsible for one another

questions.question: "...On three sides of [the chateau] cliffs dived down to where the sea licked greedy lips..."
Foreshadowing is a...

choices.answer: look back at what happened before the story began
hint about what is to come in the plot
scene that is out of chronological order
struggle between inner and outer forces

questions.question: Which of the following is the best example of foreshadowing in the story?

choices.answer: Whitney's tales of Ship-Trap Island foreshadow danger
The fact that Rainsford smokes a pipe foreshadows his death
Ivan not speaking foreshadows the story of his youth
Rainsford's construction of traps foreshadows hunting skills

questions.question: The struggle between Rainsford and the sea is an example of which type of conflict?
What does Rainsford hear that drew him so close to the ship's rail?

choices.answer: A horn blowing in the distance

questions.question: What type of mood is created when the author describes the chateau?
What is Rainsford's attitude towards animals at the beginning of the story?

choices.answer: He doesn't believe they can feel fear
He believes they are tortured without reason

questions.question: How does the General's appearance influence Rainsford's first impression?

choices.answer: Rainsford is confused by the man's attire
Rainsford thinks he is in the presence of a civilized man

questions.question: What character qualities are revealed by Rainsford's struggle in the water?

choices.answer: His strength and will to survive
His ability to reason and deduce

questions.question: What does Zaroff fear?

choices.answer: That Ivan will help the sailors to revolt
That Rainsford will not be a challenge
That he will go to pieces if hunting stops exciting him

questions.question: Why does Rainsford agree to be hunted?

choices.answer: He is more afraid of Ivan than of Zaroff
He is certain he can outwit the General
He is not given much of a choice

questions.question: What is a historical cue?

choices.answer: A hint of something that will happen in the future
An hint or indicator of when the story takes place
Something that happened before the beginning of the story

questions.question: Which word best describes the mood of the picture?
Which of the following is NOT one of the rules of Zaroff's game?

choices.answer: To win, a person has to elude Zaroff for 3 days
A person has to kill Ivan to win the game
If a person doesn't play, he is tortured by Ivan

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the traps Rainsford builds?
How does Zaroff stock his island with his ideal quarry?

choices.answer: He pays them to be there
He tricks the ships into crashing on sharp rocks
He breeds them on the island

questions.question: When Rainsford compares himself to a mouse and Zaroff to a cat this is an example of...
"The Most Dangerous Game" is told from what point of view?
Which quality do humans have that make them the ideal quarry according to Zaroff?
The MAIN conflict in the story is between...

choices.answer: Two different opinions of what the most dangerous animal is
a human being and a human evil
a person and the doubts and fears within himself
a human being and the forces of nature

questions.question: The line "I always catch my quarry. Always." shows how Zaroff is...
Theme is...

choices.answer: The main events in the story
The character development in the story
The central message of the story

questions.question: "He lived a year in a minute" is an example of...
Mood is...

choices.answer: The way the text makes the author feel
The way the text makes the audience feel
The way the characters feel in the story

questions.question: Indirect characterization is...

choices.answer: The author TELLS the audience the personality of a character
The author SHOWS the audience the personality of a character

questions.question: Direct characterization is...

choices.answer: The author SHOWS the audience the personality of a character
The author TELLS the audience the personality of a character

questions.question: Which of the following explains the irony of General Zaroff's character?

choices.answer: General Zaroff loves his family, but still hunts humans
General Zaroff claims to be "civilized" but hunts humans
General Zaroff hunts humans but mourns the loss of Ivan
General Zaroff claims to be a soldier, but he is really not

questions.question: Reason is...

choices.answer: The natural inclinations all mammals have
The ability to think critically about our choices
The "fight or flight" reactions to fear

questions.question: Which of the following BEST describes the overall mood of the story?
Which of the following quotes demonstrates Rainsford's new empathy for animals?

choices.answer: "I am still a beast at bay"
"He lived a year in a minute"

questions.question: Why does Rainsford repeat "Nerve, nerve, nerve" in the story?

choices.answer: He is in pain...he feels it in his nerves
He is reminding himself to not lose his focus and courage
He just likes the word or something

questions.question: "...the night would be my eyelids"
"...night crawled slowly by like a wounded snake"
"sleep did not visit Rainsford"
What is the most likely reason why Rainsford kills Zaroff at the end of the story?

choices.answer: He kills Zaroff out of revenge
Zaroff isn't likely to let him leave the island alive
Zaroff tells Rainsford that he won the game
Rainsford wants to save the trapped sailors
